alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 25 at 12:39PM AKST until November 26 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Winter Weather Advisories for Snow Accumulation Remain in Place for Portions of the Northern Alaska Panhandle... .A gale force low over the northeastern Gulf of Alaska continues to push a front in across the Southeast Alaska Panhandle today. This front will bring periods of heavier snowfall to several locations, including Yakutat, Gustavus, Haines, Skagway and Juneau where colder air is in place. The areas to see greatest amounts of snowfall from 3 to 5 inches will be the Haines area and Juneau, with Yakutat expected to switch back to rain for a period of time this evening resulting in lower snow accumulation amounts. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are generally expected with some isolated higher amounts to 6 inches possible. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 6 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult overnight into Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...It is possible that higher totals of snowfall could be seen in the colder back areas of the Mendenhall Valley and for higher elevations of Douglas in localized areas. Most locations near the water and along the larger highways will see significantly lower snow totals with precipitation predominantly rain in warmer areas through the evening hours before a changeover to snow takes place.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
